metadata.title: CVE-2024-27396 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: net:gtp: Fix Use-After-Free in gtp_dellink Since call_rcu, which is called inthe hlist_for_each_entry_rcu traversal of gtp_dellink, is not part of theRCU read critical section, it is possible that the RCU grace period willpass during the traversal and the key will be free. To prevent this, itshould be changed to hlist_for_each_entry_safe.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27396` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-generic - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-189-lowlatency - 5.4.0-189.209~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1133-azure - 5.4.0-1133.140~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1132-gcp - 5.4.0-1132.141~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1075-ibm - 5.4.0-1075.80~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1127-oracle - 5.4.0-1127.136~18.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
